people.name: Focquet family

Lost business during Arab Spring (Libya, Egypt important markets).

people.name: Gilbert Neirynck

Specializes in tower crane and quick-assembly crane rental, sales, assembly, disassembly, maintenance. 50 employees across 3 branches (Izegem, Mechelen, Feluy). 2 representation offices in Germany. Partnerships in UK (London Tower Cranes), Scandinavia, Turkey, Israel, Romania. 80% revenue from Belgian market. Family also has diversified real estate portfolio.

people.notes: Chemist, worked at Bayer, Glaxo, Zambon. Founded Docpharma 1999 in Heverlee (generic medicines). IPO Euronext Brussels 2001. Sold to Indian Matrix 2005 for €47M. Co-founder Uteron Pharma (women's health). Interim CEO of Mithra 2021 after François Fornieri corruption scandal. 10 children, all entrepreneurs.

people.name: Pieter Van Rompay

people.name: Audrey De Vestel

Sold to daughter Laurence and son-in-law Philippe Lhomme in 2003 for several million euros. Retired to Monaco. Art collector (Ensor, Spilliaert, Permeke). Died 2014.

people.name: Laurence De Vestel
people.notes: Daughter of Georges. Bought Batibouw 2003 with then-husband Philippe Lhomme (48% each, 4% in November holding). Divorce 2009, Lhomme paid family €12.5M for Batibouw. Sold Cocoon to Artexis. Now personal coach and founder of Vestaculture (innovative irrigation techniques). Controls Fondation de l'Eléphant / Kimbal (€40M real estate, €23M equity).

people.name: Anita Vaxelaire

people.name: John Goossens (Baron, deceased)
people.notes: Born 1945, died 2002 at 57. Studied economics UCL, MBA Columbia University NY. Worked General Motors NY 1968-71. Sales Director then CEO Texaco Belgium. Head of Alcatel Antwerp 1989. CEO Belgacom 1995-2002 (succeeded Bessel Kok, succeeded by Didier Bellens). Chairman RACB (Touring). Board member TotalFina Elf, KBC, GBL, VBO, VEV. Made Baron 2000. Died suddenly during work meeting at Francorchamps 2002.

people.name: Lucien Ranson

people.name: Ranson family (3rd generation)
people.notes: Third generation entered 2000. Revenue exceeded €80M in 2003, grew to €140M by 2011 with 230+ employees. Three business domains: 1) Supplies to artisanal/industrial bakers, confectioners, chocolatiers, ice cream makers, horeca, wholesalers in Belgium and Europe. 2) Own production of bakery products. 3) Global sourcing for fruit processing industries mainly in Europe.

people.name: Mark Vanmoerkerke (deceased)
people.notes: Born ~1952, died October 2022 at 70. Bought 100% Sunparks 1997, renovated, sold to Pierre & Vacances 2007. Took over Thermae Palace Oostende 2013. End 2018 became reference shareholder of QRF (listed real estate, retail properties Belgium/Netherlands). Son William is QRF CEO, daughter Olivia manages Thermae Palace. September 2022 opened restaurant De Keignaert in renovated family villa Oudenburg with chef Willem Hiele. Avid art collector (European/American post-conceptual art in converted aircraft hangar Oostende).

people.name: Olivia Vanmoerkerke
people.notes: Daughter of Mark. Manages Thermae Palace Hotel Oostende.

people.name: Rudolf Vanmoerkerke (deceased)

Sold Sunair to British Airtours 1997 for BEF 4B (family got BEF 1.5B = €37M). Basketball club Sunair Oostende chairman 25+ years. Art collector (Flemish expressionists: Ensor, Spilliaert, Permeke).

people.name: William Vanmoerkerke
people.notes: Son of Mark. CEO of listed real estate group QRF.

people.name: August Cras

people.name: Frédéric Cras

Late 1970s acquisitions: Van Reeth (1978), Stockmans (1983), Dubois (1985), Somex (1989). 1990s distribution expansion (Brugge, Dottignies, Oostende, Merelbeke, Relegem, Charleroi, Hasselt). Owner of Collstrop brand (garden wood products, 25-year guarantee). 2015 bookkeeper Bert W. arrested for embezzlement - €23M disappeared over 10 years. Paid €8.6M tax penalty. 2024 revenue €146M (down from €158M 2023). 2023-24 cumulative loss €25M, equity down from €56M to €46M.

people.notes: Son of Jan, age ~30s in 2024. Board member of Mabrew foundation. Preparing to enter brewery management.

people.name: Fons Martens
people.notes: Eighth generation. Was co-owner with brother Jan until 2022. Born ~1962 (5 years older than Jan). Daughter not interested in brewery. Sold stake to brother Jan in 2022.

people.name: Jan Martens
people.notes: Eighth generation, age 60 in 2022. Bought brother Fons's stake 2022. Controls 87.5% (12.5% owned by Far Eastern Group Taiwan). Two sons Jef and Bob are future management. Second largest Belgian brewery after AB InBev. 4M hectoliters/year production. 85%+ export. Major clients include Aldi. 7 packaging lines (cans, bottles, PET, kegs). 2023: 350 employees, €240M revenue. Target 2028: 4.5M hectoliters, €300M+ revenue, 95%+ export. Spain is new major market. Anchored in private foundations InvestBo and Mabrew (2024).

people.name: Jean Martens
people.notes: Founded brewery in previous century.

people.name: Jef Martens
people.notes: Son of Jan, age ~30s in 2024. Board member of Mabrew foundation. Preparing to enter brewery management.

people.name: Francis Geernaert
people.notes: Father of John. Founded Belim construction company specializing in villa construction. Sold Belim to Huyzentruyt group in 2007.

people.name: John Geernaert
people.notes: Son of Francis. Real estate developer. Holding company Green Corner. Owns former Gentse UCO-building (11-story 1959 tower, company HQ). Early 2024 bought hotel The Memlinc in Knokke from Familie Deklerck. Converting to 17 luxury apartments (avg 250m², penthouse 424m²). Target €30K/m² = €129M residential value + €21M parking (105 spaces @ €200K each) = total €150M project value. Develops residential and commercial real estate in Flanders. UCO tower was built for Union Cotonnière by baron Gaston Braun (grandson of mayor Emile Braun), who created luxury 11th-floor private apartment (Grace Kelly allegedly dined there).

people.name: Xavier Vanden Avenne
people.notes: Son of Ignace. Specializes in import/distribution of grain substitutes (tapioca) and protein products (soy meal, rapeseed meal, sunflower meal). Main markets Belgium and France. 1982 acquired Voeders Lauwers feed company. Major pig integration operation. Since late 1990s EU reform, focus on grain trading (wheat, barley, corn). Distributes ~1.7M tons agricultural raw materials annually. Sold pig integration to Danis group, feed factory to Franson. Co-investor in failed Ghent Enfinity energy company with Christophe Desimpel.

people.name: Zeno Vanden Avenne
people.notes: Started 1889 in SW Flanders trading grains and fertilizers on wife's initiative (8-hectare farm, 10 children). 3 sons joined business. 4th son became flax farmer. Family interests separated 1960.

people.name: Johan Willemen
people.notes: Father, age 72 in 2022. Led company during 2011 Aswebo acquisition (doubled staff 1000→2000, includes Kumpen co-ownership). 2010 revenue €287M. Known for major projects: Telenet HQ Mechelen, Vlaams Admin Center Leuven station. Active in Romania, Lithuania, Poland real estate development. Started Africa operations (villas, Belgian embassy Kinshasa 2014). 2021-22 liquidity crisis worsened by Ukraine war inflation. July 2022 loan from federal corona recovery fund. 2022 loss €35M, revenue down €795M→€725M. Took over from son Tom in 2022, handed to Marc Jonckheere after 2 weeks. Family equity €45M.

people.name: Marc Jonckheere
people.notes: Joined May 2022, became CEO after Tom Willemen stepped down. Restructured company: stopped foreign projects, Belgium-only operations.

people.name: Tom Willemen
people.notes: Son of Johan. Had to step down 2022 due to overexertion. Father Johan took over briefly before bringing in Marc Jonckheere as new CEO.

people.name: Guy Valckenier
people.notes: One of three siblings running the family business. Started by parents Bart Valckenier and Rolanda De Smet in 1967. Quoted about mobility solutions vs car brands.

people.name: Koen Valckenier
people.notes: Brother of Guy. Mentioned regarding bicycle leasing expansion in 2023.

people.name: Peggy Valckenier
people.notes: Sister in the trio of siblings running the business. Third generation now active in company.

people.name: Yvo Rinaldi
people.company: Les Entreprises Yvo Rinaldi (construction group, interior finishing)
people.notes: Specialized in interior finishing of new buildings, painting, concrete finishing, fire protection. Reference project: courthouse in Hasselt.

people.name: Annemie Verschetse-Vervaeke
people.notes: Wife of Freddy, co-leader of the expansion. Over 60 offices in Belgium.

people.name: Freddy Verschetse
people.company: Konvert Groep (temp agency, largest independent Belgian)
people.notes: Together with wife Annemie Vervaeke, grew Konvert to largest Belgian temp agency. Founded 1964 as Het Konvert Bureau.

people.name: Jan Ruysschaert
people.notes: CEO, took over with wife Nele Vanhouteghem. Sold to German Ottobock in 2019. Also invested in ION project development. Born ~1957.

people.name: Nele Vanhouteghem
people.notes: Daughter of founder Vanhouteghem, started as commercial director. Took over with husband Jan Ruysschaert.

people.name: Cyril Wolkonsky
people.notes: Born 1956. Married to Laetitia de Rochechouart de Mortemart. 30 years at BNP Paribas. Chairman of Iris International since 2011. Hotel investments, real estate portfolio 55,000m². 10% owner of Exki, 25% of bePharBel.

people.name: Laetitia de Rochechouart de Mortemart
people.notes: Wife of Prince Cyril Wolkonsky. Involved in family patrimony management.

people.name: Marc 'Vatje' Verstraete
people.notes: Sold Blagden 4 times to PE firms. Last sale in 2008 for €150M to TowerBrook Capital. Known as 'champion of private equity'. Owns Castigno wine estate in Assignan, France.

people.name: de Callataÿ family member
people.notes: Founding family. C&W specialized in banking software. 75% sold to French Sopra in 2012 for €100-150M. Families retain 10%.

people.name: de Wouters family member
people.notes: Co-founding family with de Callataÿ. 600 employees, international presence (Russia, Australia, Singapore, UAE).

people.name: Achiel De Witte
people.company: Cibel, Cebon (fruit & vegetable import/export), Frudicom, La Criée
people.notes: Started with vegetable stand in 1969. Built group of ~20 companies, 600+ employees. Brands: Cibel, Cebon. Bought La Criée market halls in Antwerp in 2016. Cycling team sponsor.

people.name: Bruno Mylle
people.notes: Son of Roger. Took over daily management with brother Carlo.

people.name: Carlo Mylle
people.notes: Son of Roger. Runs company together with brother Bruno. Also owns B&B Het Bintjeshof.

people.name: Roger Mylle
people.notes: Founded Mydibel in 1988 at age 49 with wife Simonne and sons Bruno & Carlo. Passion for potatoes, from farming family. Sold to Jan Clarebout in 2022.

people.name: Glenn Janssens
people.notes: Took over NV Janssens at 19 when father got MS. Bought out 3 uncles at 22. Acquired competitors, renamed to Trafiroad. 45 days in jail in 2007 for price-fixing allegations. Was married to Miss Belgium Ilse De Meulemeester. Goal: €100M turnover by 2024.

people.name: Jean-Charles Carrette
people.notes: Son of Patrick. Runs the group with 2 brothers-in-law. Founded Addax Motors in 2016 for electric commercial vehicles. Centralized operations at Blue Oak site in Deerlijk (E17).

people.name: Patrick Carrette
people.company: Westlease (sold), Garage Moderne (Ford), Addax Motors (electric vehicles)
people.notes: Started with Ford garage Moderne in Kuurne. Founded Westlease in 1977 (leasing), sold to Dutch ICL Holding in 2018 (5,200 cars). Also founded Cogenius (ICT), Elexys (energy).

people.name: Gennaro Formisano
people.notes: Founded Eurover early 1990s in Saintes near Verviers. Metal recycling and glass production (soundproof, bathroom glass, glass doors). Capital increase €21.6M in 2014. Also owns former Hotel l'Amigo in Verviers.

people.name: Geert Van Stappen
people.notes: From farming family, studied TEW, worked at Deloitte. Founded View Interim with Piet Costermans (sold to Synergie). Founded Jeni Invest in 2011 (named after sons Jens and Niels). Co-founded Invest4Talent (HR/temp agency franchises).

people.name: Jens Van Stappen
people.notes: Son of Geert, CFO at Jeni Invest. Project: Forest Hills Schoten (41 business units on 13,000m²).

people.name: Niels Van Stappen
people.notes: Son of Geert, Operations Manager at Jeni Invest.

people.name: Gribomont family member
people.notes: Family Gribomont currently holds Utexbel. Utexbel included 3 major spinning/weaving mills. Now mainly industrial real estate.

people.name: Patrick Saillez
people.company: Fimmobel (asset management from textile group Utexbel)
people.notes: Plastic surgeon from Ukkel. Leads Fimmobel holding managing real estate/assets from Utexbel textile group (Ronse). Utexbel was largest cotton group in Belgium, employed 1,200 people, supplied Levi Strauss.

people.name: Brion family member
people.notes: Family Brion owns Conti7 holding. Core activity: Conti-Lines with fleet of ~30 cargo ships (24,000 ton), 3 owned. 80% operations outside Antwerp. HQ Antwerp. Joint ventures: BoConti Shipping with CMB/Bocimar (2008), DP World Breakbulk (2007, €50M investment in Churchilldok terminal).

people.name: Frank Van Meeuwen
people.notes: Started distributing US Crestron products in Europe in 1985 from Rijmenam. Stepped out in 2014. Son Robin took over.

people.name: Petra Van Meeuwen
people.notes: Wife of Robin. Quoted: 'We are the Bentley of domotica'. Targets 15% annual growth. High-end automation for residential, industry, government. Attends millionaire fairs.

people.name: Robin Van Meeuwen
people.notes: Son of Frank. Married Petra in 1998. Moved to UK on father's request. Converted distribution to exclusive dealer agreements. Built European office network. Exclusive dealer for Europe, Africa, Middle East.

people.name: Victor Bosquin
people.notes: Founded Unibox Games. Market leader Wallonia & Brussels for café games (bingo, pinball, amusement). Also 1/3 owner of Ardent Finance (successor to Circus group) controlling casinos in Spa, Namur (Belgium), Briançon, Port Leucate (France). Co-owners: families Mewissen and Leonard.

people.name: Chris Buyse
people.notes: Former CFO of ThromboGenics, 7 years with Désiré Collen. Co-founded Fund+ evergreen investment fund for wealthy Belgians.

people.name: Désiré Collen
people.company: D. Collen Research Foundation, Thromb-X, ThromboGenics, Fund+
people.notes: Born 1943 in Limburg. Doctor/biotech entrepreneur. Developed first t-PA biotech drug for blood clots. Founded D. Collen Research Foundation (1988), Thromb-X (1991, from KU Leuven), ThromboGenics (1998, Ireland). Co-founded Fund+ with Chris Buyse. Baron (2012), Francqui Prize. Lives in London.

people.name: Van Looke family member
people.notes: Founded 1966 as producer of silo floors. Specialized in distillation towers and reactors up to 72m long, 7m diameter with titanium coating. Used for PTA production (PET bottles, polyester fibers). Spectacular cylinder transport is trademark.

people.name: Vanlommel family member
people.notes: Co-owning family with Van Looke.

people.name: Stefan Uhoda
people.company: Uhoda Group (gas stations, car washes, parking garages)
people.notes: Grandparents fled Tito's Yugoslavia. Started at Esso, then built own gas station near Kennedy bridge Liège. Grew to 75 gas stations (sold to Q8 in 2019), car washes, gas station shops, 4 parking garages. Contemporary art collector, comic fan. Organized Smurfs exhibition 2018 (240k visitors, €5M investment). Tried to bring Formula E race to Brussels.

people.name: Alain Goetz
people.notes: Son of Tony. Took over 2001 with brother Sylvain. Owner AGR (2017, 2nd largest sub-Sahara gold refinery). Lives in Dubai. Controversial: NGO reports, conflict with Ugandan officials. Still director Argor International (Luxembourg). Convicted 2020: money laundering, 18 months suspended, €3M forfeited.

people.name: Sylvain Goetz
people.notes: Son of Tony. Runs Antwerp family refinery. Formally cut ties with brother Alain. Invested in new smelter (85 ton/year capacity), PLC-controlled refining, modern lab. Clients: jewelers, manufacturers, traders, mines, funds, banks. Convicted 2020: money laundering, 18 months suspended.

people.name: Tony Goetz
people.notes: Started as diamond worker 1962, switched to diamond trading. Founded NV Tony Goetz & Zonen in 1984 (diamond crisis). Gold trading, refining. Trained as assayer in Paris. Lab, smelter, purification for gold/silver. Operations in Burundi (Affimet), City Connection Airlines, ABC Bank. Transferred to sons 2001.

people.name: Jan Adriaenssens
people.notes: Started as technician/receptionist at Jorssen (Wilrijk, BMW). Married daughter of Jorssen. At 24 became manager VW-Audi garage he could buy. Chose father-in-law's business instead. Took over Jorssen, expanded with 2 dealerships (2000). Turnover 40x larger in 25 years, doubled in 10 years. BMW 36% of turnover. Diversified into residential real estate (conservative, <30% debt). Network: architects, brokers, developers.

people.name: Kristof Sanders
people.notes: Co-founded Forum Interim in 1997 with Luc Caenepeel and brother Pascal Sanders. Each invested €50k. Indas/Trust Capital Partners (Christian Dumolin) also €50k. Specialized in French border workers. First office Roeselare, then Kortrijk. Also Argon Select for executives. 2017: Straco (De Raedt-Verheyden) bought 54.5%, Dumolin 25.5%, Patrick Sanders 20%.

people.name: Luc Caenepeel
people.notes: Third co-founder with Sanders brothers in 1997.

people.name: Pascal Sanders
people.notes: Brother of Kristof. Co-founder 1997. Combined 25 years industry experience between 3 founders.

people.name: Marnix Verbeke
people.notes: Son of Philemon. Expanded business. Sold Verbeke Bunkering to Greek Aegean Marine Petroleum in 2010. 45% market share Antwerp/Zeebrugge/Ghent/Ostend. Fleet: 18 bunker ships (9 owned). 3.5M tons fuel/year. Largest in West Europe ARA triangle. Also investor in MAC (machine room/tank cleaning) with Machiels family.

people.name: Philemon Verbeke
people.notes: Family active in shipping since late 1800s (dry bulk, fuel supply). Founded Verbeke Bunkering in 1969 as one-man business delivering Texaco fuel to inland ships. Later switched to large ships.

people.name: Virginie Dufrasne
people.notes: Age 30 (as of 2015). One of largest independent construction companies in Wallonia. Succeeded father. Economics degree. Introduced sustainable/energy-efficient housing concepts. Philosophy: 'Dare' vs father's 'Push through'. Uses credit as leverage (father more conservative). Wants to keep family character for stability.

people.name: Luc Descheemaecker
people.company: Novus Holding / Novus Projects / Novus Construct

people.role: Founder (with brother Louis), Former owner ACV

people.notes: Codic is a prominent Belgian commercial real estate developer

people.notes: Built one of Europe's largest modern art collections

people.name: Jan De Jaeck
people.role: Former co-owner Massive (sold to CVC in 2002, then to Philips in 2008), Active in real estate (Immovaar)
people.notes: Brothers Piet and Jan De Jaeck built Massive into multinational. Tax settlement of 82M euro in 2009. Jan has two daughters, Piet lives in Switzerland

people.name: Piet De Jaeck
people.role: Former co-owner Massive, Now retired in Küssnacht, Switzerland
people.notes: Left Belgium after sale of Massive

people.name: Lefevere family
people.notes: Producer of wooden furniture, TV housings, laminate plates. Founded 1900 by Felix Lefevere. Includes Triplaco (1954) and Letoplast (2004)

people.name: Detry brothers (4 brothers)
people.role: Founders of Detry meat processing company (1963)
people.notes: Produces charcuterie, salami, paté. Owns brand 'Aubel' since 1998. Acquired Polca in 2015. Production sites in Aubel and Bastogne

people.name: Francesco Melis

people.notes: IRS merged with Btech in 2011 under Fedrus Invest holding. Also active in solar panels via IRS Solar

people.name: Renaat Melis

people.name: Henri Maes IV
people.notes: Developed 'Straffe Hendrik' with daughter Véronique

people.role: Owner/Director Brouwerij De Halve Maan, developed 'Straffe Hendrik' (1981)

people.notes: Restarted brewery in 2005, launched Brugse Zot. Built famous beer pipeline in 2016 (3.2km from brewery to bottling plant). Former President Belgian Family Brewers

people.name: Gilles Samyn
people.role: Former Managing Director CNP/NPM, Former board member GBL, Chairman Degroof Petercam
people.notes: Born Jan 2, 1950. Right-hand man of Albert Frère for 37+ years. Professor at Solvay Business School (ULB) since 1981. Retired from active finance 2019. Knight in French Légion d'honneur

people.role: Professional footballer (Girona FC, Belgium National Team)
people.notes: Born Jan 12, 1989. Former Benfica, Zenit, Tianjin Quanjian, Borussia Dortmund. Owns TAWSS (real estate), invested in Lindsky aviation, former Axel Nacer clothing. Earned ~15M euro/year at Tianjin Quanjian (China)

people.name: Thierry Witsel
people.notes: Business partner in real estate ventures
